sections.title: NASA-TLX (Modified)
sections.description: Rate each item based on your experience using SketchSense.

questions.prompt: How mentally demanding was the task of using SketchSense to generate a design that matched your intent?
How physically demanding was the interaction (mouse, keyboard, visual scanning, adjustments)?
How rushed or time-pressured did you feel while completing the design task?
How successful do you think you were in achieving your intended design outcome using SketchSense?
How much effort did you have to invest to express your design intent and refine the output?
How frustrated, stressed, or annoyed did you feel while using SketchSense?
SketchSense helped me articulate my design intent more clearly than free-form prompting.
The structured parameters reduced the mental effort of deciding what to describe.
I felt less overwhelmed compared to writing a long, unstructured design prompt.
SketchSense made it easier to choose Interior design qualities instead of having to invent and phase them.
I understood how changes in parameters affected the generated design outcome.
SketchSense made the AI generation process feel more predictable.
I felt in control of the design direction rather than reacting to random results.
Overall, SketchSense effectively supports human-AI co-creation in spatial design.
